sub_title: Commercial Director Africa & Middle East | Territory Head | Harvard Business School Alumni
summary:
Gerard is a Brazilian/Dutch executive with more than 18 years of experience in the agribusiness, retail and FMCG industry focused on the food segment. 
He began his career in a citrus producer company, by leading a robust expansion plan this company became the largest lemon producer in Brazil and a major exporter.
Still in Brazil, he worked for more than 10 years in the retail sector in senior positions such as commercial director at Carrefour and in Walmart as private label BU director. To obtain a full value chain experience, Gerard moved to the food industry, working for Minerva Foods, the largest South America beef exporter as Head of strategic projects.
In 2020, he began his international professional path with Syngenta, acting as Head for Africa and Middle East, operating in more than 35 countries with a team present in 17 of them in the areas: Commercial, Finance, Marketing, Operational Marketing, Demand Planning and Customer Service. 

Professional skills and competence:
•Leadership: Strong skills to lead, developing people, identifying talents, providing direction, and inspiring teams across various functions.	
•Strategic Thinking: Ability to develop business plans, analyzing market trends, and identifying growth 
 opportunities.
•Customer Focus: Understanding customer needs, providing excellent service, building long-term relationships, and contributing to business success.
•Results-oriented mindset: Accountable for achieving sales targets, driving profitability, and ensuring overall business success.
•Financial Management: Responsible for P&L, including budgeting, forecasting and financial analysis.
•Adaptability and Resilience: Experience in dynamic environments with changing market conditions in emerging markets such as Brazil, Africa and the Middle East.	
•Decision-Making and Problem-Solving: Capable to make critical decisions and solve complex problems.
•Stakeholder Management:  Building relation with internal and external stakeholders driving collaboration and support business objectives.

Education background:
•General Management Program (GMP) by Harvard Business School.
•MBA in Management & Strategy and Executive MBA in Market Intelligence, both by FGV in Brazil.
•Professional certifications: ESG by IASE/UK and Black Belt by EDTI school/Brazil.
•40 under 40 Awards by Business Elite Awards 2022.

*Carbon neutral aligned with the Paris Agreement: Reducing and offsetting all past, present, and future emissions from my family through Blue Carbon Initiative, currently focuses on mangrove reforestation in Senegal.

•Growth initiatives projects: Specific initiatives with the goal to generate new revenue streams, increase market share, introduce new products and services. In these first years more than 15 new projects has been launched, all delivering payback in the first year after implementation.
